reviews.text: Honestly the best little soft play and cafe. Perfect for my 6 and 4 year old. So friendly and so safe. Debden is lucky to have this on the high street. Highly recommend.

Absolutely fantastic stay and play soft play for the kids. It was brilliant.
Food and drink a little on the pricey side but understandable with the costs of everything at the moment. Facilities and cleanliness was excellent and atmosphere was just perfect. I will absolutely be going again with my toddlers.

I wanted to say what a lovely, welcoming, warm place this is. It's not only a good place for my son, it's a good place for me. It's a great way to meet other mums, and other children to connect and play. It's clean, fun, and the staff are so friendly I will really miss them as I'm moving to another area. I hope I find somewhere that we love and visit as regularly as this place. Cant recommend enough! X

Took my children here for the first time today.
My older child who is 10 was watching her 2 year old brother, playing with him. I didn't pay for her as its not a big soft play for her to have fun in so I said at the desk when I entered that she is 10 and they didn't charge me. I went to the toilet and when I come out I was approached by 2 members of staff telling me I need to pay for her as she's inside playing. I said I don't mind paying but i thought she was too big to play and she was only sitting watching her brother, they said yeah you have to pay so I did.
I wouldn't of had an issue with this, but everything she done, she was told off. One member of staff kept hovering near her, telling her off for basically moving! 'Don't go on the bouncy hopper, your too big' 'get out of there it's for under 6's' (the only children in this area was my children and my friends children)  another parent actually stepped in and said but there's another child over 6 in there and they are only sitting supervising siblings. 'Don't move that, it belongs over there'
When I arrived at 3.30, they was hoovering and considering it didn't close until 5.30, my 2 year old was scared of the hoover and they was getting close to him with it.
I don't usually leave bad reviews but I spent over £25 for entry and 4 drinks for about an hour of play.
My daughter felt so uncomfortable in the end we left after an hour.
I was planning on getting the children food there but after the first 10 mins I got the feel that my older daughter wasn't welcome so I won't be returning.
I'm guessing that's why there was no one in there either.
Such shame that in a place like that, children aren't allowed to have fun.

Not really sure what to say. I booked for our family, they sent me an email saying that they had "problems with the system" and a large booking instead, asked me if I wanted to rebook or refund and then disappeared and never refunded the money. I am seriously perplexed.
Edit: after the review they got in touch and sent me the refund, all good now.

address: 65 The Broadway, Loughton IG10 3SG, United Kingdom
